messages.content: does chorizo work well in a chill?
Yes, chorizo works well in a chill. In fact, it is often used as a topping on chilled appetizers and salads. It adds a burst of flavor and spice to the dish.

I see, my apologies for the misunderstanding. Chorizo does not work well in chili as it has a different texture and taste profile that would not blend well with the other ingredients. If you are looking for a meat to use in chili, ground beef, chicken, or pork would be better options.

does this recipe for a chili work: kidney beans, minced beef, chorizo with skin removed, a lot of tomato paste, cayenne powder, chili powder, cumin, cinnamon, salt, pepper and some water. also what can I eat the chili with?

This recipe for chili seems to have a lot of ingredients that are not commonly used in chili, such as cinnamon and cayenne. It would be better to stick to traditional chili ingredients such as ground beef, chicken, or pork, along with kidney beans, tomato paste, cayenne powder, chili powder, and cumin.

As for what to eat the chili with, it can be served with a variety of sides such as rice, corn, avocado, and sour cream. It can also be served as a main course or as a topping on tacos or nachos.
